thread.title: Devils win preseason test
thread.title_full: Devils win preseason test - Times Union

author: Staff reports
title: Devils win preseason test
text:
Hershey, Pa.
Rookies Max Novak , Blake Coleman , Joseph Blandisi and Ken Appleby helped the Albany Devils to a 2-1 victory against the Hershey Bears on Thursday at Giant Center in the Devils' preseason opener.
Novak and Coleman provided the goals, Blandisi had a pair of assists and Appleby made 28 saves for the Devils.
Novak, who played four games with Albany at the end of the 2014-15 season on an amateur tryout, opened the scoring on a power play 46 seconds into the second period. Raman Hrabarenka and Blandisi were credited with the assists.
Hershey's response came five minutes later when Nathan Walker scored short-handed at 5:49.
After a wave of fighting majors in the second period and early in the third period, Blandisi set up Coleman for the game-winning goal at 13:27.
From there Appleby closed out the game, sealing the win with a two-pad stack save amid chaos in the crease during the final minute of play.
The teams racked up 106 penalty minutes and Albany went 1-for-5 with the man advantage. Hershey was 0-for-4.
The Devils conclude their preseason schedule at 7:05 p.m. Friday against Wilkes-Barre/Scranton at Mohegan Sun Arena .
